page.title: 12OLD HOUSES, STRENSHAM AREA.
page.content: {THE CIDER HOUSE.} The Cider House known as 'The Monkey' is in the hamlet of Woodmancote near Defford. It has a special old recipe for cider, but it is now produced by a wellknown Hereford Cider maker. A local inhabitant, now 81 years old, says the cider is nothing like it used to be: "One and a half pints and you could be flat out". {STRENSHAM MILL. } There has been a corn mill on this site since the 15th century. It was in use at least until last century.There was a serious fire in 1958 and it was largely rebuilt. It has a been a private dwelling for many years. It has extensive views from all the windows. The owner lets river moorings to private boat-owners at so much a foot of boat, and each plot is well kept with lawns and trees.
